Joan, Countess of Flanders, your life has been spent working tirelessly for your people and your faith. Your charters and tax exemptions played a large role in the development of towns and cities, settlers and workers would travel for miles to come to Flanders and you would welcome them with open arms. Your faith in your god was second to none, having layed the foundations for many monastic orders to take root in Flanders and flourish. Now once more, Countess, Flanders needs your governance.

Joan of Constantinople
Countess of Flanders
A woman's role, in society and the church, hold as much importance as any man.

Joan, often called Joan of Constantinople, ruled as Countess of Flanders and Hainaut from 1205 (at the young age of 6) until her death. She was the elder daughter of Baldwin IX, Count of Flanders and Hainaut, and Marie of Champagne.

Orphaned during the Fourth Crusade, Joan was raised in Paris under the tutelage of King Philip II of France. He arranged her marriage to Infante Ferdinand of Portugal in 1212. Ferdinand quickly turned against Philip, starting a war that ended with the defeat of Bouvines and his imprisonment. Joan then ruled her counties alone from the young age of 14. She faced the rivalry of her younger sister, Margaret, as well as the revolt of her domains â€“ guided by a man who claimed to be her father. After the end of the war, Ferdinand was released but died soon after. Joan then married Thomas of Savoy. She died in 1244 at the Abbey of Marquette near Lille, having survived her only child, a daughter by Ferdinand.

'The Manessier's Continuation' (also called the Third Continuation), one of the novels of the 'Story of the Grail' was written for Joan, as well as the 'Life of St. Martha of Wauchier de Denain'. The first novel in Dutch, Van den vos Reynaerde, was written by a cleric of her court.

Greetings, I am Joan, the Countess of Flanders. Perhaps God willed us to meet?
Our nearby city has seem great development as of late, you should come visit.
I would be happy to accept.
The land is to be shared and developed, an exchange of maps would do us well.
Welcome.
Your delegation is most welcome in my court, they will be treated with respect.
I can't accept.
I have sent a delegation from my court, they carry with them stories written by my own courtiers.
This is acceptable, thank you.
Only my people may travel these lands. For now.
I need access through your lands, perhaps we could come to a deal?
This is most wonderful news.
No, not right now.
I wish to offer up my friendship, and know that i do not lie, this is an honest request.
This is great news!
Shameful.
Our lands could flourish together.
You have constructed monuments to faith, it is most impressive.
Do you not aid your people? do they not need homes and work to keep busy? does faith not drive them?
Flanders will stand strong against any threat, your bravado does nothing to shake us.

I am surprised you had the sense to request such a deal.
I do not bow under such little weight.
This must come to an end, it is a waste of life.
I have lived a long life, all of it spent in service of the county. But all things come to an end. It is just a shame it came to an end at your hands.
